page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT FERNDOWN
page.content: I'm Karl. My Dad works for a local {taxi service}which operates 24 hours a day. There are 4 drivers and 4 cars. To order a taxi, you phone the service. They call the driver who will collect you. My Dad sometimes drives to Gatwick airport. We go out in our own car most of the time, but sometimes we use the taxi. My Dad has to go as far as Oxford with some of his fares. I'm Scott. My Dad works for a local {parcels service}providing next-day delivery through a{hub system.}There are 110 depots in this country. My Dad picks up parcels and brings them to his unit garage in West Moors. Night trunking vehicles take them to the{hub in Kidderminster, where they are redistributed to the depots and delivered to the customers in the morning by the local drivers.
